newsletters.subject: ğŸš¨ OpenAI connects ChatGPT to workplace apps with grounded answers
newsletters.summary:
## AlphaSignal

### Key Highlights
- OpenAI introduces Company Knowledge, connecting ChatGPT to workplace apps like Slack, Drive, and GitHub with citations.
- Google demonstrates a quantum algorithm faster than any classical supercomputer.
- Anthropic and Thinking Machines reveal distinct personalities in frontier AI models.
- Mistral AI launches a platform enabling enterprises to run AI in production.
- OpenAI expands Shared Projects, enabling Free, Plus, and Pro users to collaborate with shared chats.

### Detailed Points

OpenAI introduces Company Knowledge, a new capability in ChatGPT that connects directly to workplace apps like Slack, Google Drive, SharePoint, GitHub, and more. The feature lets ChatGPT pull context from internal tools to generate answers grounded in company data, complete with source citations.

Key Features of Company Knowledge:
- Unified context: pulls from multiple apps like Slack, Gmail, GitHub, etc. for business-specific answers.
- Grounded outputs: every response includes citations and source snippets.
- Time-aware search: handles ambiguous or time-based queries with date filtering and recency ranking.
- Work tasks: supports use cases like campaign reporting, roadmap planning, and release coordination.

How Company Knowledge Works:
- Enable â€œCompany knowledgeâ€ in the composer.
- Connect workplace apps once; ChatGPT respects existing permissions.
- Responses show a sidebar log of what sources were used.
- Click citations to view original files or messages.

Privacy & Security:
- Access limited by company permissions.
- No training on company data by default.
- Enterprise controls: SSO, SCIM, IP allowlisting, and Compliance API.

Access & Availability:
- Available now for Business, Enterprise, and Edu plans.
- Manual toggle required per conversation.
- Expanded connectors like Asana, GitLab Issues, ClickUp, etc. rolling out.

Google demonstrates a quantum algorithm faster than any classical supercomputer. This achievement marks a significant milestone in the development of quantum computing.

Anthropic and Thinking Machines reveal distinct personalities in frontier AI models. The study shows that Claude favors ethics, OpenAI efficiency, Gemini connection, and Grok risk-taking.

Mistral AI launches a platform enabling enterprises to run AI in production. The platform combines observability, runtime, and registry into a production-ready AI platform.

OpenAI expands Shared Projects, enabling Free, Plus, and Pro users to collaborate with shared chats. This feature is available now for Business, Enterprise, and Edu plans.

Google Adds Annotation Mode in AI Studio for Direct Visual Edits. This feature allows users to specify UI changes directly for Gemini.

Neo4j offers a 24-hour free NODES 2025 event, where attendees can learn how to get the data ready for their AI workshop with the improved context.

Google DeepMind offers a free AI Research Foundations curriculum with UCL, teaching AI foundations through practical coding, fine-tuning models, and transformer architecture.

Harvard professor shares practical ML systems tutorials and resources, including a comprehensive ML systems textbook, 50+ lab exercises, and TinyTorch codebase.

Anthropicâ€™s tutorial on structuring prompts with examples and roles guides users through prompt engineering in Claude models via nine chapters covering basics, clarity, roles, formatting output, examples, hallucination avoidance, and advanced complex use-cases, with exercises and answer keys.

A debugging trail that teaches PyTorch deeper than years of work, published by Elana Simon, a PhD student at Stanford University, traces a silent failure in PyTorchâ€™s MPS backend.

newsletters.summary:
## World of AI Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- DeepSeek has dropped a new AI model called DeepSeek-OCR, which compresses massive text into visual data, making AI faster, cheaper, and limitless.
- The model achieves up to 10x compression with approximately 97% accuracy and processes 200,000 pages per GPU per day.
- DeepSeek-OCR is fully open-source and available on GitHub and Hugging Face.
- The model uses a two-part system, consisting of a vision encoder and a text decoder, to compress and reconstruct text.

### Detailed Points
- DeepSeek-OCR is a groundbreaking AI model that converts text into visual data, enabling faster and more efficient processing of large amounts of text.
- The model's vision encoder maps text to visual tokens, while the text decoder reconstructs the text with high accuracy.
- DeepSeek-OCR outperforms other encoders in benchmarks, achieving top-tier edit-distance while using fewer vision tokens per image.
- The model's ability to compress text into visual data has significant implications for language models, enabling them to process larger amounts of context without hitting token limits.
- DeepSeek-OCR can be used to load massive documents without truncation, cut prompt and compute costs dramatically, and enable long-context agents that can remember everything.
- The model has been tested on a handwritten letter by Ramanujan and achieved impressive results, reconstructing the text with high accuracy.

## Medium Daily Digest

### Key Highlights
- Abdur Rahman's article "8 Refactoring Patterns That Made My Python Code Look Senior-Level" provides practical advice on writing high-quality Python code.
- Alpha Iterations published a technical guide on building Agentic RAG using LangGraph.
- Joshua Anang wrote a comprehensive overview of the math and logic behind ChatGPT, highlighting the future of language models.

### Detailed Points
- The newsletter features articles on various topics, including Python programming, artificial intelligence, technology, and personal development.
- Abdur Rahman shares 8 refactoring patterns to improve Python code, making it more readable and maintainable.
- Scott Galloway discusses the impact of pornography on society, drawing comparisons with fast food.
- Alpha Iterations provides a step-by-step guide to building Agentic RAG using LangGraph, covering the technical aspects of the process.
- William Sidnam explores the limitations of AI in imagination, highlighting the differences between human creativity and AI-generated content.
- Joshua Anang delves into the math and logic behind ChatGPT, explaining the concepts and techniques used in the language model.
- Ilya Zakharau shares his experience of transitioning from a product manager to a context dealer due to the increasing use of AI in the industry.
- Usman Writes discusses the upcoming version of PHP, highlighting the features and improvements that will make developers' lives easier.
- Other articles cover topics such as music, gamification, and iPhone apps.

### Important Articles and Links

newsletters.subject: Tether IPO, Zelle and JPMorgan Stablecoins and Crypto as Collateral
newsletters.summary:
## The Tech Buzz

### Key Highlights
- Tether is preparing for an IPO, targeting $14 billion in revenue this year.
- Zelle plans to pilot international payment services using stablecoins.
- JPMorgan Chase & Co. will allow institutional clients to use Bitcoin and Ether as collateral for loans by late 2025.
- The US and China have outlined a trade deal framework resolving TikTok's US operations, rare earth mineral controls, and potential tariff exemptions.
- OpenAI warns the US is trailing China in AI development due to a massive energy gap.

### Detailed Points
- Tether, the world's leading stablecoin provider, is preparing for an IPO, aiming to generate $15 billion in profit this year with a 99% profit margin.
- Zelle, owned by a consortium of banks including Wells Fargo and JPMorgan Chase, plans to pilot international payment services using stablecoins, extending its reach to remittances and cross-border transfers.
- JPMorgan Chase & Co. will permit institutional clients to use Bitcoin and Ether as collateral for loans by late 2025, a move that strengthens Wall Street's ties with the crypto market.
- The US and China have outlined a trade deal framework resolving TikTok's US operations, rare earth mineral controls, and potential tariff exemptions, with Trump and Xi set to meet for negotiations.
- OpenAI warns the US is trailing China in AI development due to a massive energy gap, with China adding 429GW of energy compared to the US's 51 last year.
- OpenAI advocates for investing in AI infrastructure to enhance US GDP and support reindustrialization, urging government support for tax credits and regulatory processes to bolster supply chains.
- The US is planning to launch a $5.7 million AI system from Zignal Labs to monitor social media for deportation targets, processing over 8 billion posts daily.
- Trump hints at a third presidential run, dismissing a VP bid, despite strong poll numbers, repealing the 22nd Amendment is improbable.
- Amazon plans to cut 30,000 corporate jobs across key divisions, marking its largest reduction since 2022-2023, driven by CEO Andy Jassy to boost efficiency and reduce costs.
- Nvidia is developing a robotaxi project to rival Tesla and Waymo using its Cosmos model for autonomous driving, investing $3 billion in US operations.
- Mercor, an AI training facilitator, is now valued at $10 billion after a $350 million Series C round, connecting labs with experts and paying $1.5 million daily to contractors.
- Sequoia Capital raised $950 million for early-stage ventures, including a $750 million Series A and $200 million seed fund, despite recent challenges and division separations.
- Goldman Sachs is engaged in talks with Kuwait Investment Authority for a $10 billion mandate in private equity, credit, and infrastructure, expanding in the Gulf region.
- SoftBank approved a $22.5 billion installment to finalize a $30 billion investment in OpenAI, contingent on restructuring for a potential IPO.
- Japan introduced JPYC, the world's first yen-pegged stablecoin, fully convertible to yen and backed by savings and government bonds, aiming to issue 10 trillion yen in three years.
- OpenAI's new AI strategy advocates for investing in AI infrastructure to enhance US GDP and support reindustrialization, urging government support for tax credits and regulatory processes to bolster supply chains.
- The US is trailing China in AI development due to a massive energy gap, with China adding 429GW of energy compared to the US's 51 last year.
- JPMorgan upgraded Coinbase to "overweight," setting a $404 price target, citing a $34 billion opportunity with the Base token and enhanced USDC monetization.
- Japan's yen-pegged stablecoin, JPYC, is fully convertible to yen and backed by savings and government bonds, aiming to issue 10 trillion yen in three years.
- American Bitcoin Corp. acquired 1,414 bitcoins worth over $160 million, entering the top 25 public BTC holders, with shares rising 12% to $6.28.
- JPMorgan Chase will permit institutional clients to use Bitcoin and Ether as collateral for loans by late 2025, a move that strengthens Wall Street's ties with the crypto market.

newsletters.summary:
## There's An AI For That

### Key Highlights
- Grokipedia, an AI-generated encyclopedia, has been released by Elon Musk, offering alternative framing on topics like gender and drawing from X posts for real-time updates.
- Research shows that being mean to ChatGPT improves its accuracy by 4%.
- The AI bubble survival playbook has been discussed, with a focus on investing in compute consumers rather than producers.
- A three-stage warning about AI dependency has been issued, highlighting the potential risks of relying too heavily on AI.

### Detailed Points
- Grokipedia is an AI-generated encyclopedia built on xAI's Grok model, offering alternative framing on topics like gender and drawing from X posts for real-time updates.
- Research has shown that being mean to ChatGPT improves its accuracy by 4%, with a 4% accuracy jump observed when using mean prompts.
- The AI bubble survival playbook has been discussed, with a focus on investing in compute consumers rather than producers.
- A three-stage warning about AI dependency has been issued, highlighting the potential risks of relying too heavily on AI.
- Apple Intelligence was released to the general public, bringing Writing Tools, Clean Up, and notification summaries to the market.
- OpenAI has reported that over 1 million people each week talk to ChatGPT about suicidal thoughts, and has brought in 170+ mental health experts to refine responses.
- MiniMax-M2 has been ranked first globally among open-weight models on Artificial Analysis' Intelligence Index, matching GPT-5 and Claude Sonnet 4.5 on tool-calling tasks.
- Wispr Flow, a voice typing tool, has been introduced, allowing users to type 4x faster than their fingers can across every application.
- Various AI tools have been featured, including Invent, Ideamap, Reclaim, VEED.IO, Vocal Remover, Picsart, ReelFarm, and Vmake.

## The Rundown AI

### Key Highlights
- Anthropic brings Claude directly into Excel
- Odyssey-2 turns AI video into real-time interaction
- Create a Claude Skill to design YouTube thumbnails
- OpenAIâ€™s GPT-5 to better handle mental health crises
- 4 new AI tools, community workflows, and more

### Detailed Points

- **Anthropic brings Claude directly into Excel**: Anthropic has released Claude for Excel in beta, allowing users to interact with the AI assistant through a sidebar that can read, analyze, and modify spreadsheets. The integration includes seven new connectors linking Claude to financial platforms like Aiera, LSEG, and Moody's. Anthropic also debuted several new finance-specific Agent Skills, including building cash flow models, company analysis, coverage reports, and more.
- **Odyssey-2 turns AI video into real-time interaction**: Odyssey has launched Odyssey-2, a new interactive video model that generates streaming AI footage at 20 frames per second. The system generates video segments without planning, with each new frame based on what has already happened and what users prompt in real-time.
- **Create a Claude Skill to design YouTube thumbnails**: A tutorial is provided on how to build a custom Claude Skill that automatically generates branded YouTube thumbnails by analyzing top-performing videos and applying brand guidelines.
- **OpenAIâ€™s GPT-5 to better handle mental health crises**: OpenAI has updated GPT-5 to better recognize and respond to users experiencing mental health emergencies, after consulting with over 170 mental health professionals across dozens of countries. The updated model significantly reduces problematic responses, with clinicians rating GPT-5 as 91% compliant with mental health protocols.
- **Incogni**: Incogni is a tool that removes personal data from the web, and users can get 55% off for annual plans with the code RUNDOWN.
- **Claude for Excel**: Claude for Excel is a research preview for AI in spreadsheets.
- **Odyssey 2**: Odyssey 2 is an AI video generation tool.
- **Mistral AI Studio**: Mistral AI Studio is a platform for building and deploying AI models.

newsletters.subject: Cognitive Style and Visual Attention in Multimodal Museum Exhibitions: An Eye-Tracking Study on Visitor Experience
newsletters.summary:
## Cognitive Style and Visual Attention in Multimodal Museum Exhibitions

### Key Highlights

* Researchers from Chiba University, Japan, conducted an eye-tracking study to examine how cognitive style influences visitor interaction with multimodal exhibitions in museums.
* The study found significant differences in visual attention patterns and information processing strategies between visualizers and verbalizers.
* Visualizers were more engaged with visual content, while verbalizers showed a more selective and linear processing approach.

### Detailed Points

* The study used dual-coding theory, which suggests that humans process information through two distinct channels: visual and verbal.
* Participants were classified as either visualizers or verbalizers using two questionnaires: the Verbal Visual Learning Style Rating questionnaire and the Verbalizer-Visualizer Questionnaire.
* The study used an EyeLink eye tracker to measure eye movements and track visual attention patterns.
* Six artifacts from the Liangzhu ancient Chinese civilization were presented in three different exhibition formats with increasing complexity.
* The study found that visualizers spent more time looking at visual content, while verbalizers showed a stronger pupil dilation when viewing text areas, indicating higher cognitive effort.
* The lag sequential analysis revealed that visualizers had a more distributed scanning strategy, while verbalizers had a more selective and linear processing approach.
* The study suggests that museum text is not interpreted as standalone information, but rather as referential content that requires active integration with visual elements.

Cognitive Style and Visual Attention in Multimodal Museum Exhibitions: An Eye-Tracking Study on Visitor Experience   

Human cognition isn't one-size-fits-all. According to dual-coding theory, we process information through two distinct channels: visual and verbal. Some people lean heavily toward visual processing, these are the visualizers. Others prefer linguistic and textual information, those are the verbalizers.

![](https://journalclub.io/px/Ro4PsFtgAuf1IevdOhNJpyeRcimn4PALEcA4qlLK9s48tqgVTn)

Cognitive Style and Visual Attention in Multimodal Museum Exhibitions: An Eye-Tracking Study on Visitor Experience

## TLDR Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- Amazon to lay off 30,000 staff across its corporate workforce.
- Anthropic's revenue is close to OpenAI's, with 80% of its revenue coming from corporate customers.
- Sam Altman's Merge Labs is developing a non-invasive brain-computer interface (BCI) startup.
- Atlassian's November 20 webinar will discuss AI-powered teamwork and developer productivity.
- TLDR AI is a new newsletter that provides daily updates on LLMs, GenAI, and deep learning.

### Detailed Points
- Amazon's layoffs are part of a broader cost-cutting campaign that started during the COVID-19 pandemic.
- Anthropic has around 300,000 corporate customers and expects to reach a $9 billion annual run rate by the end of the year.
- Merge Labs' BCI device may be preferable to Neuralink's BCI as it wouldn't require surgery.
- Atlassian's webinar will discuss how AI-driven workflows can help teams reduce administrative overhead and reclaim time for innovation.
- TLDR AI is a new newsletter that provides daily updates on LLMs, GenAI, and deep learning, with a focus on tech, startups, and programming.
- Saudi Arabia is building three major data center complexes aimed at foreign companies.
- Qualcomm has launched AI chips to challenge Nvidia's dominance.
- Drata's team of 80+ engineers achieved 4x more test cases and 86% faster QA cycles using QA Wolf.
- The Progress Conference is a four-day event that connects people and ideas in the progress movement.
- Grokipedia, a Wikipedia rival site, has launched and features articles on various topics, including Elon Musk's views.
- TLDR has a referral program that rewards users for sharing their referral link with friends.

newsletters.subject: LlamaIndex Newsletter 2025-10-28
newsletters.summary:
## LlamaIndex Newsletter 2025-10-28

### Key Highlights
- LlamaIndex has been recognized by TechCrunch as one of the 60 companies shaping AI.
- DeepSeek has introduced a new OCR model that compresses 1,000 text tokens down to just 100 vision tokens with 97% accuracy.
- LlamaIndex has released a new TypeScript SDK for LlamaClassify and an integration with AWS Bedrock.

### Detailed Points
- **Advanced Text-to-SQL with Arctic Models**: LlamaIndex has released a comprehensive implementation of text-to-SQL applications using open-source Arctic models and their Workflows orchestration system. This includes semantic table retrieval, multi-step workflow orchestration, and built-in error handling for production-ready applications.
- **DeepSeek OCR Revolution**: DeepSeek's new OCR model achieves a 10x compression of text tokens while maintaining quality, representing a significant breakthrough in document processing.
- **Anomaly Detection with LlamaAgents**: LlamaIndex has released a tutorial on designing, building, and deploying AI/ML-powered anomaly detection workflows using Qdrant, Supabase, and LlamaAgents.
- **LlamaClassify TypeScript SDK**: The LlamaClassify TypeScript SDK is now available, featuring a TanStack + DaisyUI demo for financial documents classification.
- **llamactl CLI Tool**: LlamaIndex has introduced a new CLI tool for building and serving LlamaAgents locally, featuring project initialization from templates, local development with auto-dependency installation, and instant deployment to LlamaCloud.
- **AWS Bedrock AgentCore Memory Integration**: LlamaIndex has integrated AWS Bedrock AgentCore Memory with their Agents for both long-term and short-term memory management, featuring secure storage, access control, and built-in scalability.
- **TechCrunch Recognition**: LlamaIndex has been recognized by TechCrunch and Greenfield VC as one of the 60 companies shaping AI.
- **Money2020 Vegas**: LlamaIndex will be attending Money2020 in Las Vegas to meet with fintech and financial leaders and showcase how AI agents are transforming underwriting, compliance, and operations.
- **Snowflake Build Session**: LlamaIndex will be participating in a session at Snowflake Build, featuring a demonstration of how to create powerful data analysis agents using Arctic Text2SQL R1 7B model and LlamaIndex Workflows.
- **AI Leader Series**: LlamaIndex has released an interview with Dhruv Shah, VP of AI Engineering at One Carlyle, discussing how intelligent agents are transforming finance by combining innovation, reliability, and trust.

newsletters.subject: Nate Herk posted "I built this AI Agent in 2 hours (and got paid $1200)"
newsletters.summary:
## AI Automation Society

### Key Highlights
- Nate Herk built an AI Agent in 2 hours and got paid $1,200 for it.
- The AI Agent was created for a client who reached out after seeing Nate's automation videos on YouTube.
- Nate emphasizes the importance of having a working demo when pitching to potential clients.

### Detailed Points
- Nate Herk, an admin at AI Automation Society, created a post about his experience building an AI Agent in just 2 hours and getting paid $1,200 for it.
- Nate mentions that he was initially just building automations for fun and posting them on YouTube to learn.
- However, someone reached out to him after seeing his videos, and they hopped on a casual call to discuss the potential project.
- Two hours later, Nate had $1,200 in his account for building the AI Agent.
- Nate attributes the ease of the pitch to having a working demo of the automation, which made it easy to show the potential client what he could deliver.
- He notes that many beginners lack demos to show potential clients, making it harder for them to pitch their services.
- To help address this, Nate is holding a free challenge (with a small catch) to help people build their first few automations.

newsletters.subject: Claude for Excel ğŸ“Š, Mercor hits $10B ğŸ’°, Qualcomm AI chips ğŸ’»
newsletters.summary:
## TLDR AI Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- Anthropic launched Claude for Excel, a tool that allows users to analyze and modify spreadsheets by chatting with Claude in a sidebar.
- Mercor, a human resources and recruiting startup, is now valued at $10 billion after finalizing a new funding deal.
- Qualcomm announced new AI chips in data center push, with shares surging 20%.

### Detailed Points
- Anthropic's Claude for Excel is currently in beta behind a waitlist, marking the company's continued push into financial services.
- Mercor manages 30,000 contractors worldwide who help AI chatbots learn how to think and speak like humans, and is currently being sued by Scale for allegedly stealing trade secrets.
- Qualcomm's new AI200 and AI250 inference accelerators are set to ship in 2026 and 2027, respectively, and are expected to help the company diversify beyond the mobile market.
- A new report from SonarSource found that each LLM has a unique "coding personality" that drives their distinct results, and that some LLMs are better suited for certain tasks than others.
- A new framework for identifying and prioritizing high-value AI opportunities was introduced, which includes a 5-step playbook for finding top AI use cases.
- A new sampling method was introduced that enables base models to reach single-shot reasoning performance comparable to reinforcement learning.
- OpenAI revealed that approximately 1-3 million users per week show signs of mental health emergencies, suicidal ideation, or emotional reliance on ChatGPT.
- A new AI-powered search engine was introduced that relies on "less popular" sources, which tend to be more accurate than traditional search engines.
- A new model, MiniMax M2, was open-sourced, which ranks #1 among open-source models on Artificial Analysis' composite intelligence score.

### Important Links
- **The Coding Personalities of Leading LLMs**: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.sonarsource.com%2Fsem%2Fthe-coding-personalities-of-leading-llms%2F%3Futm_medium=paid%26utm_source=tldr%26utm_campaign=ss-state-of-llms25%26utm_content=newsletter-ai-primary-expandedllm-251028-x%26utm_term=ww-psp-x%26s_category=Paid%26s_source=Paid%2520Other%26s_origin=tldr/3/0100019a2b0a2836-f87fb40f-04bb-4755-b47b-4772a7fbe2f2-000000/IjnSXNdu3rniLjK7S4ZIoFNOPDItc1Z25bNBe-nFScQ=429

- **The AI Startup Fueling ChatGPT's Expertise Is Now Valued at $10 Billion**: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2F9KwL47/1/0100019a2b0a2836-f87fb40f-04bb-4755-b47b-4772a7fbe2f2-000000/DMM1t-t0MNziS4hAD2O0SqJ22jSX8ixhXAhQMJC_CWg=429
